title: Why is a neutron star called a neutron star? - Why VIDYA Is? - Quora

response.answer_text: The neutron star gets its name because it is mostly composed of neutrons except the outermost layer(which is composed of iron nuclei and freely moving electrons) and the core ( thats a nobel prize worth of mystery right there🧐). However, a neutron star is also supported against the gravitational collapse due to the PAULI'S EXCLUSION PRINCIPLE or more precisely NEUTRON DEGENERACY PRESSURE i.e. no two neutrons can occupy the same quantum state at the exact same time and as neutrons were forced to come closer, there would arise a repulsive force. Thanks for the A2A.
